results.title: The School nurse; Health examination of the school entrant
results.brief_description: Introduced by Debra Lawrance. Part 1 (7 min) provides an explanation of the overall role of the school nurse. Depicts the examination of the new school entrant, liaision between the school and parents and other community bodies. Part 2 (21min) illustrates the work done by the school nurse in assessing the health and well-being of new school entrants. Medical terminology is used in this verbally dense program.

results.title: Using a computer catalogue
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Jenny Craig, Keith Rees, Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Because of changing library information systems, computerised catalogues are increasingly being used to record, store and retrieve holdings in libraries. Ann Hannan demostrates how to use the OPAC (On Line Public Access Catalogue) System, which is a touch system used in public libraries.

results.title: Building an african village
results.brief_description: A short program which outlines a Community Aid Abroad project. Victorian school children learn from a group of visiting Africans the skills of mud brick building. Designed to promote positive images of Africa and its people.

results.title: Interviewing for local selection. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Stephen Skok and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: The first part shows many of the pitfalls which may be encountered by a selection panel which has not adequately prepared itself for its important task. The second part shows how a well organised panel conducts interviews for principal selection.
results.description: The first part shows many of the pitfalls which may be encountered by a selection panel which has not adequately prepared itself for its important task. The second part shows how a well organised panel conducts interviews for principal selection.

results.title: Access to the future
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke and Mornington School Support Centre
results.brief_description: Teacher librarians in primary schools face a varied demand on services and resources. This program demonstrates the basic approaches in establishing both policy and resources. Aspects of catalogues and cooperative curriculum planning are discussed, drawing upon practical experiences of some Victorian schools. Suitable for school councils and parent presentations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris O’Rourke and Mornington School Support Centre

results.title: School support centres
results.creator_credit: Corporate Relations Unit, Western Metro Region and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Kevin Collins, Chief General Manager, Schools Division, describes the development and role of the School Support Centres and their aims and objectives in assisting the school community and teachers with a range of services and courses which will ultimately provide greater benefits to students. Features examples from a number of different School Support Centres.

results.title: Fabric painting
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Julia Wilson, Leigh Smith and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Julia Wilson from the Correspondence School demonstrates the techniques involved in fabric painting on T-shirts. Outlines the types of paints available to use on various fabrics and suggests how to make colourful patterns.

results.title: Alternatives: whole school approach to teaching English
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scollo, John Moore and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: A program about the importance of language in learning. It shows how three teachers in quite different Melbourne post-primary schools try to meet the language needs of students from non-English-speaking backgrounds.
